dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Jim Cramer on Apple Inc (AAPL): ‘When You Say That There’s Been No Innovation Since Steve, I Find That Inflammatory’
News Content: We recently compiled a list of the Jim Cramer Discusses Joe Rogan, Elon Musk, And These 13 Stocks.In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) stands against the other stocks.

In one of his latest appearances on CNBC's Squawk on the Street, Jim Cramer started the morning by commenting on the latest Producer Price Index (PPI) release. The PPI, which tracks inflation upstream of the supply chain, rose by 0.2% in December and fell short of economist expectations of 0.3%. However, this didn't lead to any significant reaction in the bond market. According to Cramer, "Carl these, the bonds just don't want to react to anything good. Of course, we can immediately say, it's because we're gonna get a tough CPI number tomorrow. The fact is, is these numbers are tame. People have to start recognizing that there are some good numbers coming."

He shared other factors that might be fueling the bond market's performance. "House prices coming down, food coming down, but it doesn't seem to matter," Cramer remarked. He added "What the bonds are reacting to I think is a new administration, uh, concern about what is going to be, uh, tariffs, even though it looks like they're going to be phased in. You know David, interest rates don't wanna come down here. And they don't wanna come down there's too much issuance, there's a belief that the next administration is much more inflationary. And David it doesn't seem to matter what is printed, the bonds don't want to go higher. Interest rate's not low enough."

Another news that has made a lot of headlines recently is TikTok's fate in the US. Cramer believes that rather than a complete bank, there could "be a gradual diminution of the service. In other words, it's not going to be turned off. I think that this whole idea that the Chinese Communist Party is really just a gigantic private equity firm leaves me cold. I just don't think that they are in a situation to broker a deal."

One person that the CNBC TV show host believes isn't discussed enough is electric vehicle billionaire Elon Musk. "I mean, Carl, it's so exciting to talk about Elon Musk. I mean we haven't talked about Elon, you know you have to wait maybe to nine o' four to talk about Elon Musk. I just say we do it at the very top," believes Cramer. He added "We have Elon Musk being the most important, well, he's, he's co-president right now which I think is a little absurd.. . . this man has become, Carl, a nation-state within. He's a state within a state."

Story Continues

On the topic of markets, Cramer was appreciative of the fact that the market and equal-weighted benchmark S&P indexes are up identically over the last six months "Well look I, that's good news actually. We want to have broader leadership," he remarked. However, without Wall Street's favorite AI stock, Cramer believes "you have a market that's kind of ruthless. . . David, you know that this market survives on NASDAQ fuel and not on Dow fuel. And yet people still insist on talking about the Dow."

Finally, Cramer has also spent quite a bit of time discussing social media CEO Mark Zuckerberg's appearance on the Joe Rogan Experience podcast. This time around, he shared "I'll go right to Joe Rogan. I'll be five hours in Joe Rogan. One of the most jarring things about the Joe Rogan interview was that he said he had to take a bathroom break. Well, there's professionalism personified." Cramer also commented on whether 38% is too much for an interviewer to speak. Taking a mixed view, he stated "I think it is. I used to put a stopwatch to my show Kudlow & Cramer. I got to speak 38% of the time so you know what, maybe it's not so bad."

Our Methodology

To make our list of the stocks that Jim Cramer talked about, we listed down all the stocks he mentioned during CNBC’s Squawk on the Street aired yesterday.

For these stocks, we also mentioned the number of hedge fund investors. Why are we interested in the stocks that hedge funds invest in? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points. (see more details here).Is Apple Inc. (AAPL) the Best Safe Dividend Stock for 2025?

A wide view of an Apple store, showing the range of products the company offers.

Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)

Number of Hedge Fund Holders In Q3 2024: 158

Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) is the most valuable consumer technology company in the world. The stock's performance in today's AI era has been mixed. Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)'s shares were laggards ahead of the WWDC conference last year, but since the event, they added 29.81% through the year. In 2025, the shares are down by 4.3% year-to-date as investors wonder whether Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) can push AI to consumers through its products and if the iPhone can sustain sales momentum. Cramer, for his part, shared his take on Mark Zuckerberg's comments that Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL)'s innovation has slowed:

"Well, I think when you say that there's been no innovation since Steve, Steve Jobs died, I don't know, I find that inflammatory. But you know what. . . .that was rough, I wanted to go to them and say could you please tell me, I wanted to call them on my Apple devices and use the 72 Apple devices I have [inaudible] and as well as the revenue stream, and talk about how we have now become integrated worldwide with Apple. But you know what let's just stick with Android."

Overall AAPL ranks 3rd on our list of the stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed. While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter timeframe. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than AAPL but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 8 Best Wide Moat Stocks to Buy Now and 30 Most Important AI Stocks According to BlackRock.

Disclosure: None. This article is originally published at Insider Monkey.

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news discusses a potential shift in investor focus away from the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, suggesting that these stocks may not perform as well due to slowing earnings growth and rising bond yields. While Apple has been previously negatively impacted by these factors, there is also mention of broader opportunities in financials and other sectors that might offer growth. Given that Apple is part of the Mag 7, which has underperformed recently and is facing pressures from macroeconomic factors, this suggests a higher probability of stock price decline in the short term.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The article discusses Apple as a Warren Buffett pick, highlighting both positive and negative aspects. Positively, it emphasizes Apple's timeless nature, significant stake held by Berkshire Hathaway (indicating Buffett's confidence), and potential growth in the AI sector. Negatively, it mentions stagnant revenue and a recent paring down of Berkshire's stake in Apple, though it suggests that might be strategic. Despite the mixed signals, the overall tone is slightly positive due to Buffett's continued large holding and Apple's AI initiatives. This translates into a higher likelihood of a price rise in the short term than a price drop. The "Double Down" ad is generic and doesn't specifically recommend the company.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news about Goldman Sachs potentially exiting its Apple Card partnership presents a mixed bag for Apple.  While the Apple Card's struggles are a negative for Goldman, the impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be muted. The article highlights that Apple is adept at navigating such situations, and a smooth transition to a new partner is possible, minimizing disruption to users and the Apple ecosystem.  The potential for some short-term negative market reaction due to uncertainty is present, but Apple's overall strong financial position and broader product ecosystem are likely to outweigh the specific impact of the Apple Card partnership change. The focus on Goldman's financial issues and Apple's capacity for innovation suggests that any negative impact on Apple's stock will be temporary and relatively small compared to the overall market factors.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline suggests a negative outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock, implying potential challenges or risks that could lead to a decline in its stock price. While the content of the news is not provided, the headline alone indicates bearish sentiment. However, without specific details on the reasons (e.g., financial performance, market conditions, or external factors), the analysis is limited to the sentiment conveyed by the headline. Given this, the probability of a stock price fall is higher than a rise, but the exact probabilities are uncertain due to the lack of detailed information.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's investment choices, highlighting Apple Inc. (AAPL) as one of his top picks. Despite recent stagnant revenue and iPhone sales, the article suggests that Apple is on the cusp of significant growth, particularly with its advancements in AI technology and processor chip development for AI data centers. The article also mentions that Berkshire Hathaway still holds a significant stake in Apple, which could indicate confidence in the company's future prospects. However, the recent sale of 600 million shares by Berkshire may indicate a lack of confidence or a strategic move to manage their portfolio. Overall, the article presents a positive outlook on Apple's potential for growth, which could influence investor sentiment positively.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news about Goldman Sachs potentially exiting the Apple Card partnership may cause short-term uncertainty and could negatively impact Apple's financial products. However, Apple's history of innovation and ability to pivot smoothly may mitigate the risks. The potential disruption to Apple Card and Savings products could affect user experience, but Apple's strong brand loyalty and ecosystem may limit the long-term damage. Considering these factors, the probability of a significant stock price movement due to this news is moderate.

(AAPL), with an analyst criticizing the perceived lack of innovation post-Steve Jobs. However, the overall market context and the company's strong position in the technology sector suggest a balanced outlook. Analysts argue that investors should consider other stocks in the S&P 500 that may provide better growth opportunities. Apple's recent underperformance and the broader market skepticism, particularly regarding tech stocks, imply a higher probability of a stock price decline in the near term. However, some analysts still view Apple as a strong investment due to its past resilience and ongoing innovations. Therefore, I estimate a higher likelihood of a price fall compared to a rise.

The focus on Apple's new AI initiatives is a positive catalyst for future growth. Considering both positive and negative elements, along with previous predictions, particularly the recent increase in bullish sentiment from some models, the probability of a stock price rise is slightly higher than a fall. This considers the inherent uncertainty in stock predictions and the mixed signals in the news article.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news about Goldman Sachs potentially exiting the Apple Card partnership presents a relatively low-impact event for Apple's stock price. While it introduces some uncertainty regarding the Apple Card's future and could cause minor short-term volatility, several factors mitigate the risk of a significant price drop. Apple has demonstrated a strong ability to adapt and innovate.  A switch in partners is unlikely to severely damage the Apple ecosystem or drastically change user experience, given Apple's control over its platform.  Furthermore, the news focuses on Goldman Sachs' financial struggles, rather than any inherent weakness in the Apple Card itself.  Previous predictions show a range of opinions, with most leaning slightly toward a price decrease.  However, the magnitude of the predicted decreases is generally modest. Considering these factors and the overall strong performance of Apple, the probability of a price fall is slightly higher than a rise, but the difference is small.  The news is unlikely to be a major catalyst for significant stock movement in either direction.
